task.title: Search Characters
task.shortdesc: Search for characters in the IPA Map by glyph name or features.

step.cmd: Click inside the search bar in the top right corner of the window, and type a glyph name, feature, or feature shorthand. Alternately, click on the down arrow in the search bar to select either Glyphs or Features search, and then input the search term.
step.stepresult: A set of Search Results will be displayed at the top of the IPA Map window.Although Glyphs search is the default search type, if the text input exactly matches a feature name or a 3-character feature shorthand, the IPA Map will display search results for that feature. However, this does not happen automatically when searching for single-character feature shorthands (e.g. "c" for consonant or "v" for vowel). See Listing of phonetic features for a list of all features and shorthands used in Phon.

step.cmd: When finished with your character search, click the Clear field/X button to the right of the search bar.
